hints.content:
There are $\purpleD{461}$ homes. Of those, $\maroonD{352}$ homes are apartments, and the rest are not apartments.

![A tape diagram models that the 461 homes are equal to the 352 apartments and the unknown number that are not apartments.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/edb8f88af7332fe6e62d8c4c7d2eb1f4dc12b141)

$\purpleD{461}-\maroonD{352}=\blueE{?}$

![Place value blocks show 461 blocks with 352 blocks crossed out](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/00a4f08d27e4bd8e6a405a757f7c0d9570a59b79)
There are $\blueE{109}$ homes that are not apartments.

question.content:
There are $461$ homes in the part of town where Samir lives. He counted that $352$ of those homes are apartments. 

**How many of the homes are not apartments?**

[[â˜ƒ numeric-input 1]] homes
